msItem.author: Thomas Aquinas
msItem.title: Summa Theologica, Tertia Pars
msItem.incipit: Quia Saluator noster Dominus Ihesus Christus teste angelo populum suum
msItem.explicit: non distinguitur premia moralium et uenialium

181 leaves (ii + 178, incl. 150A) 325 225
265 165
The edges heavily retrimmed affecting running heads and marginalia, and spattered with red.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 50 lines. Running heads on a line ruled right across the page.

handDesc.handNote: A single English gothic rotunda bookhand of university type, at first writing rather formally. The scribe corrects his work in the margins.

decoDesc.decoNote: On f. 1 is a 7-line initial in colours and gold with stylized foliage, on a squarish ground. Red or blue initials flourished in the other colours; red or blue paraphs. For a while quaestio-numbers are given in red and blue capitals in the margins. Running heads in red.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii; sewn on five bands. On f. i, the pastedown in an earlier binding, is a small mark, perhaps of an iron chain-staple, at the foot near the foredge. On f. 177v are the marks from the large iron chain-staple. These marks do not appear on f. 178, which was probably inserted s. xvii.

history.provenance: Made commercially in Oxford. The chain-staple mark shows that it was at the College by s. xv ex. At the head of f. 1 is ‘Liber Bibl: Coll: Merton’, s. xvii. Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with contents and ‘D. 4. 6’, s. xvii, and ‘N. 6. 9. Art:’, canc. and replaced with ‘I. 1. 4 (LXXV)’ in red; the College bookplate. ‘9’ is inked on the foredge.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.
